DOC.detailed_description: In United States , pain account nearly 20 % primary health care visit . In majority case , pain musculoskeletal primarily affect low back , hip , knee . Studies show least one-third patient pain also suffer depression . It determine whether treatment depression effective patient comorbid pain depression . The `` Stepped Care Affective Disorders Musculoskeletal Pain '' ( SCAMP ) study determine effective treatment patient pain depression . This study last 12 month comprise depress nondepressed participant . Nondepressed participant receive treatment . Depressed patient randomly assign receive standard care step care 12 week . Standard care may include cognitive therapy , antidepressant treatment , treatment . The stepped care group receive 12 week antidepressant treatment . Participants respond antidepressant treatment continue treatment duration study . Participants respond treatment 12 week receive 6 weekly pain self-management session . During session , educator teach participant manage pain exercise relaxation technique . Self-report scale questionnaire use assess participant ' pain , depressive symptom , health care usage cost , quality life . Depressed participant undergo assessment study start Months 1 , 3 , 6 , 12 . Nondepressed participant undergo assessment study start Months 3 12 .
